review: Easy to use straight out of the box. Provides good quality streaming of video. Let's me readily show my Amazon prime videos and listen to prime audio. It also works alright with Netflix but I find it easier to still watch my Netflix items using my TIVO premiere.  Not very expensive and provides good value for the modest cost.  It also passes the spouse test as my wife finds it easy to use, even though watching through the home theatre system requires switching to HDMI2 instead of HDMI1 for the TIVO feed.Most difficult task of the setup was trying to figure out how to open the battery compartment. Took me 30 minutes and some intemperate language and finally resorted to finding a Youtube video that revealed the secret. (Which way does the cover come off: answer the big part comes off, not the top) A simple illustration in the extremely sparse setup pamphlet would have helped. Doesn't take up much space on yourI recommend it if you are an Amazon Prime customer.  Probably not quite as useful if you are not. Do remember it only works if you have a reasonably decent internet connection. Before I purchased I read all of the reviews for FireTV and FireStick.  I think the majority views FireTV as a better bargain overall but it is three times the cost.She particularly likes the voice command for search. It recognizes both our voices quite well.  Would be nice if you could call up a genre of videos using the voice command.  Maybe the next iteration of the software will support choosing Sci Fi, Action, Romantic, Comedy or whatever.
